channel.title: BBC News | Technology | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Social sites wrestle for top spot
item.description: Bebo and MySpace are fighting for dominance of the online social networking scene, research shows.

item.title: Smart sites to power semantic web
item.description: The big talk at the WWW2006 conference is about the semantic web with its promise of an "intelligent" net.

item.title: Nike and Apple join up for runs
item.description: Nike and Apple, two of the world's best-known brands, join forces and make equipment for runners.

item.title: Privacy worries over web's future
item.description: An "intelligent" web could pose serious privacy issues, a senior UK researcher has warned.

item.title: Web inventor warns of 'dark' net
item.description: The inventor of the web, Tim Berners-Lee, has warned of the dangers of introducing a two-tier internet.

item.title: Vonage flotation to raise $531m
item.description: Vonage, the loss-making internet phone company, is set to raise more than $530m in its first public share sale.

item.title: Free music ends Sony CD saga
item.description: A US judge has approved a deal to settle lawsuits against Sony's record label over the use of anti-piracy software.

item.title: Police act on German file-sharing
item.description: German police charge 3,500 users of a file-sharing network with illegally offering music for download.

item.title: Call to target UK software piracy
item.description: More than a quarter of all the PC software used in the UK is pirated, reveals a report.

item.title: US challenged over .xxx decision
item.description: The backer of the .xxx domain is trying to find out if the US government blocked its plan for an internet home for porn.

item.title: Downloads boosts EMI profit
item.description: Strong demand for music downloads helps EMI unveil a 13% rise in full year profits to £159.3m.

item.title: Sky HDTV runs into trouble
item.description: A set-top box shortage means 17,000 Sky HDTV subscribers cannot watch the service, which launches on Monday.

item.title: Invitation for 'silver surfers'
item.description: Older people across the UK are being given the chance to try out the internet as part of Silver Surfer Week.

item.title: Microsoft reveals Vista checklist
item.description: Microsoft has unveiled hardware specifications for Vista - the next version of Windows.

item.title: User-generated future for gaming
item.description: Gamers are creating their own environments in new games such as Spore, created by guru Will Wright.

item.title: War vets debut in US army game
item.description: The US Army is putting soldiers who fought in Iraq into its game in a bid to put a human face on its operations.

item.title: Satellite radio in recordings row
item.description: US satellite broadcaster XM is being sued over a gadget that lets people record what they are listening to.

item.title: Football fever boosts Fifa game
item.description: Catch up with the latest news from the world of video gaming.

item.title: Top spin tennis courts success
item.description: Top Spin 2 for the Xbox 360 does a competent job of bringing the game to life in your hands.
